sentences.english: But many do mislead (men) by their appetites unchecked by knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 有许多人，必因自己的私欲，而无知地使别人迷误。

sentences.english: For any whom Allah leaves astray, there is no protector thereafter.
sentences.chinese: 真主使谁迷误，在真主的弃绝后，谁没有任何保护者。

sentences.english: And those whom Allah leaves to stray, no one can guide.
sentences.chinese: 真主使谁迷误，谁就没有向导。

sentences.english: Truly those in sin are the ones straying in mind, and mad.
sentences.chinese: 犯罪者的确在迷误和烈火中。

sentences.english: It also had unavoidable mistakes and defects.
sentences.chinese: 也有当时难以避免的迷误和不足。

sentences.english: The materialists start off from objects, and from this, would fall into "placing importance on the outside world".
sentences.chinese: 唯物主义者从客体出发，从而陷入了“法执”的迷误。

definition: to lose one's way/to get lost (on the road etc)
agnosticism, the philosophical doctrine that some questions about the universe are in principle unanswerable
to diverge from the main road, also figuratively
dualism, belief that the universe is made of two different substance (e.g. mind and matter or good and evil)
to exhort (sb) to live a virtuous life (Buddhism)/to beg for alms
